title: ranked system makes no f**king sense
body:
So all the people that aren't stuck with all the Bronze noobs say win more is the key to getting out. So let's assume that's actually true...

I'm looking at a Diamond 2 player that has never played ranked until this season. Their ranked win rate is 135W 114L (Win Ratio 54%).
I have never played until this season and my win rate is 161W 144L (Win Ratio 52%) yet I'm stuck in Bronze 1.

I've also looked at their stats and their Per Game Averages (cs, towers taken etc etc) are pretty similar to mine. I also have seen them stream multiple times and they really don't do anything special infact half the time they aren't even looking at the map etc coz they are reading their stream chat. I guess they can get away with that cause higher tier are more predictable than bronzers. Bronzers will just do stupid unpredictable stuff...

The ranking system is just horrible and makes no sense at all. Really wish Riot would do something about it cause it's so stupid and annoying.

And no I don't belong where they've put me. I have played approx 150 games on my friends gold smurf and still maintain a similar win rate as I do on my account.

Fix your s**t Riot cause it's annoying.

> the people that are trying to say Riot measures attitude despite they have zero knowledge or proof of my attitude ingame and assume they can tell my ingame attitude from a forum post.

No one has claimed that Riot can "measure" your attitude, but your attitude ***does*** have an effect on the way you play and, just to be clear, it's not hard to tell what a person is like in-game if, when they post on the boards, they're constantly blaming Riot and "bad team mates" (and even using profanity). Attitude doesn't change that much between the game and the boards.

Posting on a forum and playing a game are two completely differant things and someones attitude towards either thing cannot be determined from the other thing. Please point out your quote "bad team mates". I don't think you'll be able to since I never said that and I never said anything about team mates let alone blamed bad team mates. I also never used profanities. 

If you would like to know a little about my ingame attitude I'll fill you in so you don't have to keep assuming wrongly. I do not use profanities ingame (censored ot uncensored), I do not rage on people even when they are bad and/or feeding.

Lets take an example of a recent game just now. I'm mid doing fine like usual (I rarely lose mid when I get it) warding my stuff, cs'n, not feeding, pinging if I see someone has a gank incoming etc. We have a top that that has fed 4 kills in first 8 mins. I tell them to ward because it's better to spend gold on wards than give the other team gold, be out of lane losing xp n cs, to play safe & that I'll try to come up and help when I can. You can't really have a better attitude towards this than what mine was and guess what this persons response was "stfu". That's a bad attitude. My attitude is nothing like this ever.

Like I've said my attitude is perfectly fine, better than average and NOT the issue/problem. Would you like to try again? Come up with something more plausable?

> Please point out your quote "bad team mates".

When I say "bad team mates" it means I'm generalizing the people you consider to be the problem. In this case, that's the people who supposedly report you for being unskilled when there is apparently no basis for such reports. And I would like to point out you've used terms that would be consistent with "bad team mates" twice in this thread. For example:
Bronze noobs (assuming you're not one of them)
bronzers (again, a derogatory term towards the bronze population, which you are a part of.

> I also never used profanities.

I guess that means the classic "Fix your s**t Riot" isn't profanity?

> I do not use profanities ingame (censored ot uncensored), I do not rage on people even when they are bad and/or feeding.

I can see two things wrong with this claim. Firstly, that's not what I meant. I simply meant that your attitude was negative enough to cause you to be "dragged down" in-game and struggle to climb. That doesn't automatically mean I was talking about the worst of "negative attitude" (being offensive language, harassment etc.). Secondly, I can't trust you are being truthful about your attitude in-game. You have a biased view point on the matter, naturally you are going to think you aren't as bad as you actually are (even think there isn't a problem when there is). It's something that happens to everyone, so don't try to deny it. If a Rioter where to come into this thread and confirm what you are saying I would believe it but, so far, the only person to claim your attitude isn't a problem is you.

Bronzers is not a derogatory term. They are bronze what else should I be calling them? And no "Fix your s**t Riot" is not a profanity. Why on earth would you think it is?

My attitude ingame is fine like I said forums and playing a game cannot be compared and I NEVER blamed team mates EVER let alone said "bad team mates" like you seem to think I did as you put it in quotation marks. I never said that don't try to pretend I did by making it seem like you quoted me. Just admit that you assumed I blamed team mates cause that's what everyone does when they complain? When the fact is I blamed the ranking system for being broken, provided evidence why I thought it and did not blame anything else. 

Anyways, I've finally managed to climb up and I'm currently in Gold 4 100LP. I didn't change a thing... I stand by my claim that the system is broken. Yes, I'm getting to where I belong BUT it should not have taken as long as it did. I'm very happy where Iam and actually enjoy playing the game now since for the most part I'm playing with people on my level, not with people that are unskilled and prone to afk, rage quit etc since they have nothing to lose being at the bottom.

Guess I wasn't where I belong...lol.

Yeah that's pretty unfair. I think it was Phreak that said something like if you started your account selecting "beginner" as compared to "expert" you would get placed lower after ranked provisionals. But yeah from viewing games I can see that there's not much difference in skill between bronze and silver. Theres usually two scenarios in these lower leagues: game is either a complete stomping, or its just a chasefest where whoever gets the baron wins the game. People in higher tiers have better mechanics and **sometimes** better decision making. But in solo queue on the OCE server it seems to be just a slugfest with no real strategy. I haven't seen a single game where a team wards an objective **well in advance** in preparation to take it, like the pros do. From what I've seen from OCE solo queue viewing, people under challenger level just don't have a good grasp of strategy.

Anyone can be a "godlike hero" with mechanics, but if they are not a team player, and the opposition play as a team, then its most likely the "hero" will lose.

> The ranking system is just horrible and makes no sense at all. Really wish Riot would do something about it cause it's so stupid and annoying.

I would agree with this. Using a ranking system that was designed for a solo player game is foolhardy. Because league is about teamwork, and if you are using this formula to rank people based on how their teammates perform then its just not going to be accurate. Perhaps a better ranking system would include some stats like your average KDA from the game, objectives taken or assisted, etc, in addition to the current "mmr" system. 

I can understand why he would be frustrated, if he is a better player, but is being held back by noob teammates who don't understand the game so well. People are now going to say "well if he is better he should be carry the game", but **how much** better does he have to be to carry the game? Because lets say he is playing at silver level but his teammates are not working as a team then he has no chance to carry a bronze game. If the ranking system was fixed, then he would be placed into a proper skill tier, where games would not only be challenging but **enjoyable**.

>Because lets say he is playing at silver level but his teammates are not working as a team then he has no chance to carry a bronze game.

Let's assume this is the case. Firstly, it's stand to reason that most (if no all) games are this situation (as is the standard excuse [yes, it's an excuse]). Secondly, considering all 10 players in a single match are picked from the same pool of players, it stands to reason this same situation occurs **just as often** (within a negligible margin of error) for the opposing teams. Given that, it stands to reason that the player in question (in this case, OP) should be doing as much winning as losing from this scenario and it actually has minimal to no effect on how the matchmaking works.
Basically: It's true, bad teammates are a problem ***for individual games*** however they have minimal to no effect on where a player ends up in the long term.

> [{quoted}](name=HeartVine,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=N2sbGzqI,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2015-08-19T05:35:47.342+0000)
>
> Basically: It's true, bad teammates are a problem ***for individual games*** however they have minimal to no effect on where a player ends up in the long term.

Sure from a **large sample size** of that players games, in the long term it has no effect. However this means that the silver player has to grind out thousands of games to get to where he should belong in the first place. Also on various days he could be winning a lot of games, and then on other days he could be losing a lot of games. I.e. his rating is **mostly** dependent on other people.

Scenario

Game 1: Team feeds, loss
Games 2: Stomping, win
Game 3: Someone afks, loss

....

What I'm saying is that surely there is a better way to rank people. Skill is not just based on who wins and who loses a game. Especially in a team game. You could be the best cricketer in the world and your team still loses, e.g. Brian Lara didn't always have a great team, despite being a god at batting.

Anyways, I've finally managed to climb up and I'm currently in Gold 4 100LP. I didn't change a thing... I stand by my claim that the system is broken. Yes, I'm getting to where I belong BUT it should not have taken as long as it did. I'm very happy where Iam and actually enjoy playing the game now since for the most part I'm playing with people on my level, not with people that are unskilled and prone to afk, rage quit etc since they have nothing to lose being at the bottom.

Guess I wasn't where I belong...lol.

Oh ok so now it's attitude that fixes Riots stupid ranking system. Please try to actually read the evidence Ive presented instead of just posting irrelevant nothingness.

Actually, attitude can have just as much (even more) of an impact on how well someone does when compared to skill. All the time we get people like you coming onto the boards complaining about this kind of thing and in pretty much every instance they have a very crappy attitude. Compare those people to others of a similar skill level who actually control their attitude and have a more positive outlook on things and you start to see a pattern.

I have presented evidence of two almost identical accounts being ranked so much differantly. Clearly my attitude isn't the problem because my statistics are practically identical to this diamond player yet we are ranked so far apart... Seems to me the true problem is the ranking system.

Two ***partially similar*** accounts used by two ***potentially vastly different*** individuals amongst ***millions*** is ***NOT*** proof. If you can show your supposed skill is similar/the same when compared to a significant amount of higher ranked accounts then that ***might*** suggest you should be higher than you are, but that's not the case.
One is enough to show that it's broken. I shouldn't be able to find any examples.

> One is enough to show that it's broken.

No, it's not. When you consider that just one result could likely be an outlier then it's just a matter of "you need more than one result to prove your point".

I highly doubt that's possible since this is OCE and there probably isn't even a million regularly active ranked accounts. And how do you explain my ability to play completely fine and not get massacred on my friends gold account then if I don't belong there?

I would like to point out I was talking about the **entire league community** not just OCE. That's, what, 10(?) servers? More? Easily millions of active ranked accounts. The fact you can play on a gold account and play relatively fine means pretty much nothing in OCE. While it may not seem like it, the skill difference between Bronze, Silver and Gold isn't that big. In fact some people would argue that Platinum is even in the same boat.
I agree with klav fix your attitude to the game.

So can anyone actually explain why **two accounts that are basically identical can be ranked so much differantly**? The only explanation I see for this is cause the ranking system is broken and doesn't work.

Someone from Riot wanna explain how this can happen and assure us the system is fair?
